channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-22165] Synchronisation introduced by HIVE-14296 on SessionManager.closeSession causes high latency in a busy hive server
item.description:
HIVE-14296 introduces this commit which adds synchronization to SessionManager.closeSession.

And it looks like it is used only for logging purposes.

In a busy hive server where 5-10 sessions are created closed every second, an increase in latency of any other downstream services (Zk, HDFS) causes a queueing effect (lot of threads getting blocked on SessionManager.closeSession) creating an induced latency of 3-5 minutes at times for just closing the session. 

Since the gauge (MetricsConstant.HS2_OPEN_SESSIONS) is already tracking the open session counts, the synchronization (along with the additional logging) can be removed without any functionality losses.
item.summary: Synchronisation introduced by HIVE-14296 on SessionManager.closeSession causes high latency in a busy hive server

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Used sessionAddLock and also reduced the scope of synchronisation to handleToSession key removal and logging.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12979051/HIVE-22165.patch
